diagnosis.final_diagnosis: PHD2 mutation-related congenital erythrocytosis with recurrent paraganglioma
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis is based on the findings of a newly discovered PHD2 mutation affecting PHD2 function, leading to erythrocytosis and the occurrence of a recurrent abdominal paraganglioma. Loss of heterozygosity of PHD2 in the tumor suggests PHD2 acts as a tumor-suppressor gene.
